CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many chords are in this chord chart?
How many outer arcs are in this chord chart?

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the clockwise direction from arc East Junction?
SRP.A: The next arc clockwise from arc East Junction is arc {Skyline Station}.

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the counterclockwise direction from arc East Junction?
SRP.A: The next arc counterclockwise from arc East Junction is arc {Harbor Point}.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest output flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {Harbor Point} has the largest output flow.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest input flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {Skyline Station} has the largest input flow.

VE.Q: What is the flow value from South Gate to Skyline Station in the chord chart?
What is the flow value from South Gate to East Junction in the chord chart?
What is the flow value from Harbor Point to East Junction in the chord chart?

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value between South Gate and Metro Center in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The maximum flow value between South Gate and Metro Center is {145}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum flow value between East Junction and Harbor Point in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The minimum flow value between East Junction and Harbor Point is {16}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value in the chord chart?
What is the minimum flow value in the chord chart?

SC.Q: What is the total flow output from East Junction?
SC.A: The total flow output from East Junction is {201}.

SC.Q: What is the total flow input by East Junction?
SC.A: The total flow input by East Junction is {236}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow greater than 123? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {145} from {South Gate} to {Metro Center}, a flow of {190} from {Harbor Point} to {Skyline Station}, a flow of {138} from {Skyline Station} to {South Gate}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow less than 63? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {3} from {South Gate} to {Skyline Station}, a flow of {53} from {Harbor Point} to {East Junction}, a flow of {16} from {East Junction} to {Harbor Point}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow between 74 and 96? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {88} from {East Junction} to {Skyline Station}, a flow of {74} from {South Gate} to {East Junction}, a flow of {96} from {Metro Center} to {South Gate}, a flow of {75} from {Skyline Station} to {Harbor Point}.

NC.Q: Which flow is larger: from Skyline Station to East Junction or from South Gate to Metro Center?
NC.A: The flow from {South Gate} to {Metro Center} is larger.

NC.Q: Which flow is the largest: from Harbor Point to Skyline Station, from South Gate to Metro Center, or from East Junction to South Gate?
NC.A: The flow from {Harbor Point} to {Skyline Station} is the largest.

MSR.Q: Which category has the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow?
MSR.A: The category with the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow is {Harbor Point}.

MSR.Q: Which pair has the strongest chord connection in this chord chart?
MSR.A: The strongest chord connection is between {Harbor Point} and {Skyline Station}.

VA.Q: To minimize the crossings between chords, please reorder the outer arcs and list the reorder arc order in clockwise direction.
VA.A: The reordered arc order in clockwise direction is: {Arc Metro Center, Arc South Gate, Arc East Junction, Arc Skyline Station, Arc Harbor Point}.
